section.title: Discussion
section.para: In most cases, it is enough to just use an empty link element. As such, you should avoid this notation:
This is mostly unnecessary as it is overly verbose, difficult to read, and does not add any value. Correct such links to this notations:
If you want to control the link behavior, for example, to open a new window when clicking it, use the xlink:show attribute (only for DocBook 5.x):
The attribute value show opens a new window, frame, pane, or other relevant presentation context (see Common Linking Attributes). Of course, this is only useful for online formats.

Apart from the general linking attributes, DocBook 5 also adds new concepts. One of this new concepts are that every element can be a link. In other words, you do not have to use a link element anymore. If you have a book title and you want to add a link to it, just use citetitle.
